This is a preliminary program. Please return to this page regularly to get updated information.

Confirmed Speakers

  • Antonio Miguel Vieira Monteiro - INPE - Brazil
  • Andrea Iabrudi Tavares - Federal University of Ouro Preto
  • Carl Kopescharr - De Grote Griepmeting - Holland
  • Claudia Medina - UFRJ
  • Cristina Guimarães - ICICT/Fiocruz
  • Ethel Maciel - Federal University of Espirito Santo
  • Gabriela Gomes - Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência
  • Mauricio Barreto - Federal University if Bahia
  • Mauro Teixeira - Federal University of Minas Gerais
  • Oswaldo Sergio Farhat de Carvalho - Federal University of Minas Gerais
  • Renato Assunção - Federal University of Minas Gerais
  • Robert Muggah - Instituto Igarapé
  • Ronaldo Lemos - FGV
  • Sander van Noort - Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência
  • Trevor Bailey - University of Exeter

Thematic Areas

  • Data sources and their availability. Current status and challenges.
    • Compliance with the Information Access Law
    • Machine accessibility to public datasets
    • Data harvesting from Social media
    • Heterogeneity of data sources: challenges to integration and cross-referencing
    • Maintenance and Updating of data.
  • Data analysis
    • Challenges of analyzing Large Datasets
    • Streaming data analysis
    • Information Visualization and visual analytics:
    • Data-driven Science
    • Machine Learning
    • Mathematical Modeling
    • Statistical Modeling
    • Record Linkage
  • Big Data Applications in Public Health
    • Syndromic surveillance
    • Epidemic Intelligence and early warning systems
    • Disease incidence surveillance
    • Climate and Disease surveillance
    • Online inference of health risks
    • Large scale simulation and scenario analysis
